business.headline: Sensex surges 1,000 points as FIIs chase Dalal Street rallyBull run on Dalal Street: The S&P BSE Senses added 1,003.06 points to 77,908.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 286.95 points to 23,637.35 as of 12:37 pm.

Is India's middle class losing momentum? See what this expert saysThe rise of automation is a growing threat to jobs. Machines are replacing traditional roles in both factories and offices. The next phase of automation, powered by generative AI, is expected to accelerate job displacement across multiple sectors, Saurabh Mukherjea said.

Why foreign investors are rushing back to bet on Dalal Street FIIs returning to Dalal Street has given a sharp boost to domestic investors, with the main indices extending gains for the sixth consecutive session. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 950 points and Nifty rose 273 points.

Stock market rally: Check top gainers and losers on Dalal StreetSensex surged over 800 points to surpass the 77,700 mark, and Nifty jumped over 200 points to trade above the 23,500 level as Dalal Street continued its winning streak.

Why Trump's tariffs aren't spooking Dalal Street investors anymoreForeign investors are back, and markets are rallying. But with Trump's reciprocal tariffs set for April 2, will the optimism last, or is another sell-off on the way?

Sensex jumps over 1,000 points, extends rally: 3 things to knowStock Market Today: As of 11:06 am, the S&P BSE Sensex went up by 1000.10 points to reach 77,905.61. At the same time, the NSE Nifty50 increased by 289.85 points to 23,640.25.
NCC share price jumps 5% after Rs 1,480 crore hospital redevelopment orderNCC Ltd's stock price jumped in early trade after the company secured a contract worth Rs 1,480 crore.

Defence stocks are rising again. Is BHEL a good buy after recent order wins?Having declined over 24% in the past six months and over 9% in 2025, the stock has finally started showing signs of recovery. In the past month it has gained 11% and nearly 8% in the past five trading sessions.
Sensex, Nifty gain as energy stocks rally and foreign inflows surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 579.88 points to 77,485.39, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 160.85 points to 23,511.25 as of 9:26 AM.

Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher: How to trade on Dalal Street today?Dalal Street is expected to open higher as the overall market sentiment remains positive, with traders watching key levels for further movement.

Sensex, Nifty opening prediction on March 24: What to expect from D-Street todayNifty50 posted its biggest weekly gain in over four years, driven by renewed interest from foreign investors and expectations that the recent market decline has come to an end.

Stocks to watch on March 24: RIL, Ola, Raymond, Adani Green, Mahindra & MahindraAs markets resume trading, several stocks will be in focus due to key developments. These include Reliance Industries, Mahindra & Mahindra, Ola Electric, Adani Green, Adani Enterprises, NCC, Dr. Reddy's, Max Healthcare.

entertainment.headline: Hina Khan expresses happiness as her hair grows after chemotherapyTelevision star Hina Khan, who has been diagnosed with cancer, recently debuted her new look during an awards ceremony. She expressed her happiness at the regrowth of her hair post-chemotherapy.

Case against Bigg Boss Kannada contestants for posing with arms on social mediaAn FIR was filed against two past contestants of reality show Bigg Boss Kannada for posing with a weapon, raising concerns for public safety.

Kesari 2 teaser: Akshay Kumar promises powerful retelling of Jallianwala BaghThe teaser for Akshay Kumar's Kesari Chapter 2: The Untold Story of Jallianwala Bagh was released on Monday. It explores the events following the massacre, with Akshay Kumar portraying Sir C Sankaran Nair.

Mahira Khan reunites with Raees co-star SRK on set, but there's a twistPakistani actor Mahira Khan reunited with Shah Rukh Khan on a shooting set. The actor's pictures on social media have sparked excitement among fans.

Dia Mirza demands apology from media after CBI's clean chit to Rhea ChakrabortyThe CBI filed a closure report to Mumbai court, stating that no evidence was found to establish any foul play behind actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death. Actor Dia Mirza demanded an apology from the media for the 'anguish' caused  to Rhea Chakraborty and her family during trial.

Sooraj Barjatya recalls narrating Uunchai script to Big B: Took anxiety pillsFilmmaker Sooraj Barjatya opened up about his experience of narrating the script of Uunchai to Amitabh Bachchan. The director admitted to taking anxiety pills to calm his nerves during the process.

'Papa, Kattapaa': How Salman Khan introduced Sathyaraj to father Salim KhanActor Sathyaraj spoke about how Salman Khan introduced him to his father, Salim Khan, at the Sikandar trailer launch. The actor will be seen playing the antagonist in AR Murugadoss's Sikandar.

Deepika Padukone calls out Oscars for snubbing Indian films, recalls RRR momentActor Deepika Padukone expressed her disappointment over India's repeated snubs at the Oscars. She believes that Indian films and talent have been overlooked too many times by the prestigious awards.

Tamannaah defends playing Shiva Shakti in Odela 2, discusses 'milky beauty' tagActor Tamannaah Bhatia will be seen as sadhvi Shiva Shakti in her upcoming Telugu film, Odela 2. She defended director Ashok's choice and said that the 'milky beauty' tag is not something to be ashamed of.

Amitabh Bachchan, Rani Mukerji's Black co-star is now married, see first picsAmitabh Bachchan's Black co-star Ayesha Kapur got married to her longtime boyfriend Adam Oberoi in Delhi on March 23. The first picture of the couple as husband and wife is finally out.

Brad Pitt faces legal hurdle over faulty houses for Hurricane Katrina victimsBrad Pitt is facing a significant legal challenge as a lawsuit filed by Hurricane Katrina victims progresses. The actor's charitable housing project in New Orleans has come under scrutiny.

Actors Nayanthara, Nivin Pauly wrap Dear Students shootActors Nayanthara and Nivin Pauly have completed filming for their upcoming movie, Dear Students. On Sunday, they shared a fun video celebrating the occasion with a party alongside the cast and crew.

BB 18's Mannara Chopra criticises airline for denying boarding, gets trolledActor Mannara Chopra recently slammed an airline for not allowing her to board the flight. The actor shared her ordeal in a video on social media.

KJo calls Adolescence 'blasterclass' for parents, terms the show as forever lessonFilmmaker Karan Johar is the latest celebrity to share his review on Netflix's Adolescence. The director-producer called it a 'forever lesson' and a 'loud wake up call to parents'.

Viral: David Warner brings 'Pushpa' magic to Telugu debut film eventCricketer David Warner recreated the steps of the song 'Srivalli' from Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise' at the event of his Telugu debut film, Robinhood. The cricketer will play a cameo in the film.

Anirudh Ravichander's roaring Hukum show sets Chepauk ablaze before CSK vs MISinger and composer Anirudh Ravichander set Chepauk Stadium ablaze with his electrifying 'Badass' performance on Sunday. He energised the crowd with his act ahead of the CSK vs MI match, creating an electrifying atmosphere.

Rashmika on working with Salman Khan in Sikandar: What could be bigger than thatActor Rashmika Mandanna is thrilled as she prepares for the grand release of Sikandar, where she stars alongside Salman Khan. Set to hit theatres on March 30, the film marks their first collaboration.

Salman Khan on 31-year age-gap with Rashmika: Will even work with her daughterSalman Khan addressed trolls over his tired look and age-gap criticism, saying he'll work with his heroines' daughters too. He also joked about proving to social media that he's still around.

Salman Khan on working with Rashmika in Sikandar: She reminds me of my younger selfAt the Sikandar trailer launch event on Sunday, Salman Khan reminisced about working with his co-star Rashmika Mandanna. She also taught the superstar how to make her signature Korean finger heart gesture.

general news.headline: Won't tolerate this, Kunal Kamra should apologise: Devendra Fadnavis on joke rowMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis slammed stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra amid a row over his joke on Eknath Shinde, saying no insults or defamatory remarks against leaders will be tolerated.

Delhi High Court derosters Justice Varma after cash recovered from his homeDelhi HC judge Yashwant Varma's judicial duties were withdrawn after cash was found at his residence following a fire incident.

Tech entrepreneur alleges harassment by wife, Chennai cops over child custodyThe founder of the software company Rippling and tech entrepreneur Prasanna Sankar made serious allegations against his estranged wife, amid their divorce and custody battle. While he claimed harassment by the police, the wife accused him of financial and sexual misconduct.

Sensex surges 1,000 points as FIIs chase Dalal Street rallyBull run on Dalal Street: The S&P BSE Senses added 1,003.06 points to 77,908.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 286.95 points to 23,637.35 as of 12:37 pm.

Should housing societies have right to ban certain types of food? What India thinksIndia Today's inaugural Gross Domestic Behaviour (GDB) survey found 54 per cent of the respondents supported prohibition on certain types of food by housing societies.

Why Rohit Sharma's Champions Trophy method should take a backseat in IPL 2025Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a four-ball duck in the opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Chennai Super Kings (CSK). After the game, former cricketers Krishnamachari Srikkanth and Shane Watson had some suggestions for Rohit on his approach in recent times.

Kunal Kamra mocks Eknath Shinde, 11 Sena workers arrested for ransacking venueKamra, known for his witty remarks and sharp commentary, is now embroiled in controversy over a video in which he is seen mocking Eknath Shinde. 11 Sena workers were arrested for vandalism.

Chaos in Parliament over Karnataka Muslim quota, BJP says Congress dividing IndiaThe Karnataka State Cabinet earlier approved an amendment to the Karnataka Transparency in Public Procurement (KTPP) Act, which aims to provide a four percent reservation in tenders to minority contractors.
The weight-loss drug dilemma: What happens when you stop?While weight-loss drugs provide temporary solutions, experts stress lifestyle changes as the most effective way to maintain a healthy weight.

Meerut murder case: Muskan's parents disown her, refuse to provide legal helpSaurabh was allegedly murdered by his wife and her lover, with his dismembered body sealed inside a plastic drum filled with cement in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The case came to light on March 18.

Dia Mirza demands apology from media after CBI's clean chit to Rhea ChakrabortyThe CBI filed a closure report to Mumbai court, stating that no evidence was found to establish any foul play behind actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death. Actor Dia Mirza demanded an apology from the media for the 'anguish' caused  to Rhea Chakraborty and her family during trial.

Know your rights, DGCA tells airlines to share passenger info via SMSThe DGCA has mandated Indian airlines to inform passengers about their rights regarding delays, cancellations, denied boarding, and baggage issues. Airlines must share a link to an online passenger charter via SMS, WhatsApp, tickets, and their websites. IndiGo has already started implementing this directive.
Can Aaryan Shukla's maths technique make your child a prodigy?Aaryan Shukla's mental maths skills stunned one and all, including Anand Mahindra. Can the technique turn your child into a prodigy too?

Ground report: Two years on, Manipur is more divided than everThe division has extended to such an extent that not just the people, but even security forces and bureaucrats are facing it. India Today TV recently visited the state, including Churachandpur - epicentre of conflict between the Kukis and Meiteis - to understand the status as the violence nears two years.

12-year-old builds nuclear fusion reactor, gets visit from FBI12-year-old Jackson Oswalt, from Memphis, US, has built a nuclear fusion reactor in his bedroom and made a Guinness World Record for the youngest person to achieve fusion. Later on, he got a visit from the FBI to make sure all was good.

Russia's drone attacks kill 7 in Ukraine as truce talks underway in Saudi ArabiaThe attacks, including on the capital, Kyiv, came ahead of ceasefire negotiations in Saudi Arabia in which Ukraine and Russia are expected to hold indirect US-mediated talks today.

Delhi woman takes the wheel after Uber driver falls ill, urges people to learn drivingA video of a Delhi-based woman driving an Uber cab after the driver fell sick midway has gone viral on social media.

From the India Today archives (2022) | Prayers in conflict: The mandir-masjid warsIt was supposed to stop with Ayodhya. But Kashi, Mathura, Sambhal and a flurry of other mandir-masjid disputes signal a new phase of Hindu revivalism

Tiger Woods reveals he is dating Donald Trump's ex-daughter-in-lawTiger Woods, the 82-time TOUR winner, confirmed his relationship with Donald Trump's ex-daughter-in-law Vanessa Trump after posting a couple of pictures on his social media account.

Mumbai standup club's powerful post after Sena vandalism, shuts down temporarilyIn a long Instagram post, Mumbai's Habitat Studio announced its decision to shut down temporarily after Sena workers attacked the venue after a controversy over Kunal Kamra's joke on Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

sports.headline: Tamim Iqbal admitted to hospital in critical condition after chest pain in Dhaka leagueTamim Iqbal has been rushed to the hospital in critical condition after he suffered from chest pain during a Dhaka Premier League match between Mohammedan Sporting Club and Shinepukur Cricket Club.

Fifty at 50: MS Dhoni tipped to achieve incredible IPL feat by Navjot Singh SidhuNavjot Singh Sidhu has claimed that MS Dhoni could achieve an incredible feat in the IPL by scoring a fifty at the age of 50. Dhoni started his 18th season of the IPL with a win on Sunday, March 23.

IPL 2025: LSG pacer Mayank Yadav's recovery faces setback with fresh injuryJustin Langer revealed that Mayank Yadav has faced a setback in his recovery with a fresh injury. Mayank injured his toe while rehabbing and his return date has been pushed back further.

Royal Challengers Bengaluru launch new green jersey in KolkataIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bangalore will don a green jersey during one of their matches to highlight the importance of environmental protection and promote the message of greenery.

DC vs LSG, pitch, weather report IPL 2025: Will rain affect Vizag clash?Delhi Capitals and Lucknow Super Giants are all set to square off in an intense North Indian derby in Vizag. How will the pitch and weather behave on Monday, March 24.

Ishan turns round corner for SRH: 2 sessions a day at his academy in PatnaIshan Kishan, out of the national team and Mumbai Indians made a sensational comeback in IPL 2025. Ishan scored a hundred in his first match with SRH.

Even if I am in a wheelchair, CSK will say 'Don't worry, you play': MS DhoniLegendary India and Chennai Super Kings (CSK) wicketkeeper batter MS Dhoni addressed his retirement rumours and said that his team is even willing to play him on a chair.

Noor Ahmed spins CSK to dominant win as MI's opening-day jinx continuesIPL 2025, CSK vs MI: Noor Ahmed's spin-bowling masterclass and steady fifties from Rachin Ravindra and Ruturaj Gaikwad helped Chennai Super Kings begin their campaign in style. Mumbai Indians lost their opening game for the last 14 years in the T20 league.

Who is Vignesh Puthur? Auto rickshaw driver's son is MI's latest scouting gemIPL 2025, CSK vs MI: 24-year-old Vignesh Puthur was scouted by Mumbai Indians when he was playing club cricket in Kerala. The left-arm wrist-spinner, an auto-rickshaw driver's son, was a net bowler with MI Cape Town in SA20 2025.

Kishan thanks Cummins, 'different' team environment after century-start at SRHIshan Kishan fit right into the scheme of SRH, hitting a terrific century in the first match of IPL 2025. Kishan spoke after the game and thanked captain Pat Cummins for the freedom that he was given.

Here's how social media reacted to Dhoni's outstanding work with the gloves.

Watch: 43-year-old MS Dhoni affect lightning quick stumping in CSK vs MIMS Dhoni stunned the fans once again with some lightning-quick work behind the stumps. Dhoni's glove-work helped CSK see the back of Suryakumar Yadav on Sunday, March 23.

Ishan Kishan 106, SRH 286 too much for Rajasthan in Hyderabad run-festSunRisers Hyderabad stamped their authority in their opener of the Indian Premier League. SRH beat Rajasthan Royals by 44 runs in a high-scoring affair at their home on Sunday.

CSK vs MI Highlights: Rachin, Ruturaj guide Chennai to 4-wicket win vs MumbaiCSK vs MI Highlights, IPL 2025: Rachin Ravindra finishes the match with style as MS Dhoni watches on from the other end at the Chepaul Stadium. CSK beat MI by 4 wickets to win their first match of the season. Mumbai's opening match jinx continues.

Jofra Archer registers most expensive spell in IPL history, gets hammered for 76 runsRajasthan Royals fast bowler Jofra Archer registered the most expensive bowling figures in the history of the Indian Premier League as he leaked 76 runs in his four overs against Sunrisers Hyderabad in Match 2 of IPL 2025.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
